alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 10:27PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: .Periods of moderate to heavy rainfall will continue over the next hour or two before tapering to scattered showers by midnight. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western Nebraska, including the following county, Scotts Bluff. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 927 PM MDT, emergency management reported urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in Scottsbluff and Gering. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Scottsbluff and Gering is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Terrytown, Scotts Bluff National Monument and Hubbard Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
